item.title: Roblox: Combat Warriors Kill Sound IDs List (September 2025)
item.description:
Combat Warriors is similar to many other Roblox shooters, but it is especially addictive and fun because of its fast pace. In fact, someone dies here almost every second, so the developers decided to add kill sounds to diversify the gameplay. Roblox players interested in a complete list of Combat Warriors kill sound IDs can find it below.

Updated September 21, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Combat Warriors has received a batch of new kill sound IDs that bring even more variety to your matches. The latest additions include both funny and intense effects, giving you more ways to personalize your gameplay. With options ranging from memes to dramatic tones, there’s something for every style. Keep checking back for updates so you can stay ahead with the freshest sounds.

All Combat Warriors Kill Sound IDs (Combat Warriors Codes)

Combat Warriors has recently gained wide popularity, and players have fallen in love with this game because of its action and drive. The developers are eager to support this project and add various maps and new features, including more Kill Sound IDs. This article is constantly updated to provide players with all the latest information. Below, fans can find a list of Kill Sound IDs:

Updated September 21, 2025, by Artur Novichenko:

How to Redeem Kill Shound IDs in Combat Warriors

Redemption of Kill Sound IDs in Combat Warriors is a very simple task. However, if players are still having problems, this step-by-step guide should help to solve them. They should keep in mind though that to unlock the ability to redeem a Kill Sound ID, players will need to pay 199 Robux.

  • Open Roblox and launch Combat Warriors.
  • In the main menu of the game, find the settings.
  • Click on it.
  • Go to the "Audio" tab.
  • Enter the above IDs in the "Kill Sound ID" field.

Combat Warriors Tips and Tricks

To begin with, players need to learn how to move correctly, slide, dash, stomp, and so on, which will lead to success. The next step is to master the combat mechanics. It's not that difficult. Players just need to hit the enemy at the right moment. Completing daily quests is also a key to success, as these quests offer in-game currency with which players can buy new weapons.

Best Roblox Fighting Games Like Combat Warriors

One of the best things about Roblox is the huge variety of games on offer. This bodes well for those who are starting to get bored of their favorite Roblox games, as there are usually plenty of great alternatives just waiting to be discovered. Below, players can learn about the five best Roblox games like Combat Warriors :

  • Project Slayers
  • A One Piece Game
  • Arsenal
  • Dragon Blox
  • Base Battles

About the Combat Warriors Developers

The developers of Combat Warriors never released any other games. But, their group in Roblox already has more than 900K members, and this only indicates the good quality of the project and the hard work of the developers.

13

item.title: Roblox: Arcade Basketball Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Even though Arcade Basketball has a simple gameplay, your victory depends directly on your skills. Whether it is defense or attack, you need to use the right skills to run and earn Coins. For this reason, new players are quite slow to farm money. And to fix this, you should use Arcade Basketball codes.

As expected from Roblox codes, they contain various rewards from the developers. Most of them grant players different amounts of Coins. However, their validity is limited, so it is recommended that you redeem them as soon as possible.

Updated September 21, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Arcade Basketball has several codes you can use to grab free rewards like coins, spins, crates, and XP. Some codes are available right away, while others require following certain accounts or joining a Roblox group. These rewards can help you progress faster and unlock new features in the game. Keep an eye out for future updates since more codes may be added over time.

All Arcade Basketball Codes

Working Arcade Basketball Codes

  • LAUNCH - Redeem this code to get Crate (NEW)
  • FREESPINS - Redeem this code to get Spins
  • 4700Likes! - Redeem this code to get 300 Coins
  • THANKS - Redeem this code to get 300 Coins
  • Release - Redeem this code to get 300 Coins
  • Group - Redeem this code to get 300 Coins (Requires joining a Roblox group)
  • SkeletorAngel - Redeem this code to get 500 XP (Requires following the @SkeletorAngel user)
  • SOLOSEBEE - Redeem this code to get 250 Coins (Requires following the @SOLOSEBEE user)
  • 4p0 - Redeem this code to get 250 Coins (Requires following the @4p0 user)

Expired Arcade Basketball Codes

  • 5KLIKES - Redeem this code to get 300 Coins
  • 10KLIKES - Redeem this code to get 300 Coins

Arcade Basketball offers players an exciting basketball experience. Instead of playing in the usual big fields, you will have to play a maximum of 2v2 with one basket. But this does not mean that it will be easy for you to win. Depending on whether you play defense or offense, you have access to different moves. Using them at the right time, you can easily both score goals and protect the basket from opponents. And to diversify the matches, players can customize their characters by buying crates with items. And if you want to earn a lot of money from the beginning of the game, then Arcade Basketball is what you need.

Even a few of these codes will reward you with more than 500 Coins, which is enough to buy one crate. But it is worth noting that after some time, the codes expire. For this reason, you need to use them while they are still active.

How to Redeem Arcade Basketball Codes

At first glance, it may seem that Arcade Basketball has the same code redemption feature as most other Roblox experiences. However, in reality, most codes require certain conditions to be met, such as joining a group or following a user. But by following these steps, you can easily claim your rewards without any problems:

  • Launch Arcade Basketball .
  • Open the Menu by clicking on the corresponding button in the lower left corner of the screen.
  • Next, select the Codes option.
  • After that, you must make sure that you have fulfilled a certain code condition and enter it in the field.
  • Finally, click the Confirm button to claim free goodies.

How to Get More Arcade Basketball Codes

To avoid missing out on new Arcade Basketball codes, you should bookmark this guide, as we are going to update it over time, like our other Roblox codes articles. In addition, you can visit the official social media pages of the developers. There, players will find all the latest news about upcoming events, updates, and of course, codes:

  • Arcade Basketball Roblox group
  • Arcade Basketball Discord server
Roblox

item.description:
Jump Links

  • All Blue Lock Rivals Sound ID Codes
  • How to Use Blue Lock Rivals Sound IDs
  • How to Get More Blue Lock Rivals Sound ID Codes

Blue Lock Rivals is a soccer game on Roblox with a huge active user base. This is not surprising, as the developers are constantly working to improve gameplay and add new content.

One of the game's great features is the ability to add custom sounds for goals and other actions. If you want to diversify the gameplay, you should use the Blue Lock Rivals sound ID codes from our guide.

Updated September 21, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Blue Lock Rivals has added some new sound IDs that you can use in-game. These fresh options give you more variety when customizing your experience, from intense effects to fun meme sounds. The collection keeps expanding, so there’s always something new to try out. Be sure to check back often so you don’t miss the latest additions.

How to Use Blue Lock Rivals Sound IDs

Sound IDs in Blue Lock Rivals are straightforward to use, but there is one inconvenient detail that may be concerning for many players. To apply custom sounds, you must purchase a game pass for 109 Robux. However, this is a small price to pay, so it's worth buying if you're a fan of this Roblox game. To help you, we've created a step-by-step guide explaining how to redeem codes in Blue Lock Rivals .

  • Launch Roblox and open Blue Lock Rivals .
  • Look at the bottom of the screen with a bunch of buttons. You need to click on the rightmost button, Settings.
  • Next, you will see three text fields. Enter the code in one of them, depending on your preference. Then click Set.
  • If you don't have a game pass yet, buy it. After that, you will be able to use different sound IDs during the game.

How to Get More Blue Lock Rivals Sound ID Codes

Blue Lock Rivals Sound ID codes can be found all over the internet, for example, on TikTok or in guides like this one. We cannot recommend a specific source for the sounds as there are so many of them, so we recommend bookmarking this page in your browser, as we will be updating it with new cool sounds from time to time.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem May Be Stuck in a Catch-22 After the Recent Leak
item.description:
As more details about Resident Evil Requiem come to light, fans of Capcom's long-running action horror series have been eager to find out if Leon S. Kennedy will make an appearance. Resident Evil Requiem surprised a lot of gamers at this year's Summer Game Fest with the announcement of the long-awaited next chapter in the series, but what was even more shocking was that the game will be introducing a brand-new protagonist.

Grace Ashcroft is set to lead Resident Evil Requiem 's story this time around, and while she looks to be an intriguing character, many are hoping that veteran faces will show up in at least some capacity, especially a fan-favorite like Leon. It's been a long time since he has been featured in a fresh Resident Evil game, and a recent Requiem leak claimed to reveal a picture of Leon's character model for the game. However, this leak may not be as accurate as some would like to believe.

Resident Evil Requiem's Leon Leaks Are Likely Fake, Which Could Be Both Good and Bad News

The Leon S. Kennedy Leaks Explained

Earlier this week, a leaker shared a picture of an older-looking version of Leon wearing an eye patch. This took a lot of fans by surprise, with many being quick to joke that Leon looks more like Big Boss than the RPD officer that they love. It didn't take long for this image to be debunked, though. Prominent Resident Evil leaker Dusk Golem claims that the Leon image is fake. Of course, there's no way to actually know for sure. Indeed, the eye patch-wearing Leon could be fake, but Dusk Golem could also be incorrect. It's hard to say until Capcom finally lifts the veil on whether Leon will actually be in Requiem or not. If he is, though, then this leaked character model creates a difficult situation for the character.

If Leon is in Requiem, His Look Will Be Both a Blessing and a Curse

On the one hand, there are plenty of Resident Evil fans who found the character model to be goofy, but others thought Leon's makeover was cool. If the image is accurate, it's bound to be a divisive change for such a beloved character, but if the picture happens to be fake, fans of the makeover are bound to be disappointed that Capcom kept it safe with his character design. There are still plenty of unanswered questions surrounding Requiem , and the rumors about Leon being in the story are the biggest of all.

Requiem 's director, Koshi Nakanishi, has stated in past interviews that Leon is a "bad match for horror," because of his experience and bravery. While this has led many to think that Leon is going to be completely absent, there is still hope for a cameo. Nakanishi took a similar route with RE7 by introducing newcomer Ethan Winters, but Chris Redfield eventually made an appearance, which led to a larger role in Village . Grace Ashcroft's inexperience is intended to heighten the horror, and while that's great, it would be a little disappointing to not see Leon or any of the other franchise veterans.

More Requiem News is Bound to Come to Light

  • Resident Evil Requiem launches on February 27, 2026.
  • It will be available for Nintendo Switch 2, PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X/S.

There are still a few months left before Requiem is here, and in that time, Capcom is bound to make further announcements and reveals. Rumors about Requiem 's playable characters continue to pop up, and with The Game Awards looming in the distance, it's possible that a Leon reveal will finally happen.

Only time will tell, though. So, until then, it will be fascinating to see which Requiem leaks and rumors prove to be true and which ones were merely trying to ignite hype.

Resident Evil Requiem

item.title: Trying to Kill Time Until Diablo 4 Season 10? This Brand-New Steam Game Has You Covered
item.description:
Season of Infernal Chaos, the tenth upcoming season for Diablo 4 , is going to bring with it a lot of permanent changes to the game. Blizzard recently revealed in a blog post on its official website that the controversial boss invulnerability phases, for example, will finally be adjusted in Season 10. Going forward, these invulnerability phases will only occur 10 seconds after a player takes on a Lair Boss. High-level players, therefore, will no longer have to worry about spending longer on a boss battle than they should. As is typical of a seasonal update, Diablo 4 's tenth season will also introduce some new limited-time features, such as Chaos Rifts and Fleeting Hordes.

The next season of Diablo 4 is going to come out on September 23 on all available platforms. While Blizzard hasn't given fans an exact idea of how long the season will last, the Diablo 4 roadmap that the company released a few months ago suggests that it will be available until early 2026. Even though Season of Infernal Chaos is just a few days away from being released, players who can't wait to get their hands on the update should try some other, similar games out in the meantime. There's a newly-released Deep Rock Galactic spin-off, in fact, that may make the wait for Diablo 4 Season 10 a little more bearable.

Diablo 4 Fans Should Check Out Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor Before Season of Infernal Chaos' Launch

Aside from the fact that they both support co-operative online multiplayer, the hit first-person shooter Deep Rock Galactic is almost nothing like the Diablo games. Its recent spin-off, however, titled Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor , has more than a few passing resemblances to Diablo . Unlike the game that it was spawned from, Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor is an isometric single-player shoot' em up that takes a lot of inspiration from Vampire Survivors . The game lets players assume the role of a dwarf who goes on a mission to mine ore and other resources, coming face-to-face with hordes of enemies and challenging bosses in the process.

Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor Has a Class System, Sort of Like the One in Diablo 4

Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor allows players to choose between various classes and roles when customizing their characters. One class, for example, allows players to drill through enemies, while another gives them the ability to easily dodge enemy attacks and move around quickly. The roles, meanwhile, modify the weapon loadout and base stats of the playable characters. By mixing and matching these classes and roles, players can find the gameplay style that best suits them.

There are 5 stages, or biomes, in Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor . Each of these biomes has its own unique mechanics that make the game progressively more difficult.

Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor is Playable on Xbox and PC, as Well as Game Pass

Even though some players probably haven't heard of it, Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor has actually been available to the public for more than a year. The game originally came out in early access on Steam in February of last year, but it didn't get a 1.0 launch until only recently. Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor is playable right now on PC and Xbox Series X/S, and it's available via Game Pass Ultimate, just like Diablo 4 . The developers of the game, however, have yet to confirm if it will come to PlayStation 5 or Nintendo Switch 2 in the future.

Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor Isn't Exactly the Same as Diablo 4, But It May Scratch a Similar Itch

So far, the reception to Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor has been largely positive. Although some players have been critical of the game's grindy nature, a lot of people seem to consider it one of the better Vampire Survivors clones out there. Sadly, though, the game doesn't support co-operative multiplayer like the original Deep Rock Galactic does, so players will not be able to play it with their friends for the time being. While Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor may not be exactly the same as Diablo 4 , given that it's an auto-shooter and not a true action RPG, it may be able to scratch the Diablo itch for some gamers until Season of Infernal Chaos's launch.
